itemDescription: British recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Wright VC (1826 – 28 July 1858) was a British Army soldier and an Irish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: Alexander Wright or Alex Wright may refer to:
*Alexander Wright (American football) (born 1967), American football player and college coach
*Alexander Wright (VC) (1826–1858), Irish soldier in the British Army and Victoria Cross recipient

The regiment embarked for Jamaica in February 1824Woollright, p. 53 and lost many men to fever thereWoollright, p. 54 before returning home in June 1834.Woollright, p. 56 It embarked for Malta in November 1837Woollright, p. 58 and for Corfu in February 1842.Woollright, p. 59 It then embarked for Jamaica again in January 1843 and went on to Halifax in Nova Scotia in January 1846Woollright, p. 60 before embarking for home in May 1848.Woollright, p. 61 It sailed for Malta in March 1854Woollright, p. 69 and, having landed at Scutari in April 1854,Woollright, p. 70 saw action at the Battle of Alma in September 1854,Woollright, p. 77 the Battle of Inkerman in November 1854Woollright, p. 83 and at the siege of Sevastopol in winter 1854.Woollright, p. 91 Sergeant John Park and Private Alexander Wright were awarded the Victoria Cross for their actions during the war. The regiment returned home in July 1856.Woollright, p. 106
*Private Alexander Wright, Crimean War (22 March 1855 and 19 April 1855)
*:*Alexander Wright, soldier, recipient of the Victoria Cross for gallantry in 1855 at Sebastopol, in the Crimea (died 1858).
